column1:
The rule is, 'Do the simplest thing that could possibly work', not
the most stupid.

Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good
programmers write code that humans can understand.
_ A class should have only one reason to change.

_software entities (classes, modules, functions, etc.) should be open for extension,
but closed for modifcation

_objects in a program should be replaceable with instances of their subtypes
without altering the correctness of that program
_One should depend upon abstractions. Do not depend upon concretions.
